name: Cash Assistance Program for Immigrants (CAPI)
short_desc: A monetary assistance program for legal non-citizens who have little or no income, who are either age 65 or older, or individuals of any age (including children) who are blind or disabled and do not qualify for SSI due to immigrant status
description: A benefits program for legal non-citizens in financial need that are either age 65 or older, or individuals of any age (including children) that are blind or disabled and do not qualify for SSI due to immigrant status. CAPI benefits vary depending on one's living circumstances and income. It is always $10 less than the applicable SSI rate.Alameda County Social Services offices provide for pick-up and drop-off of applications.Belmont site serves as phone inquiry, central processing, and in-person appointment site (no drop-ins), located at 400 Harbor Blvd, Belmont, CA 94002.Eligibility Technician at Hayward (Amador) office speaks Cantonese.
